title: Job Vacancies at Euracare
content:
Euracare is a leading healthcare provider in Nigeria, committed to delivering world-class medical services with a patient-first approach.o provide world-class medical services to patients without the stress and expense of international travel. To offer corporate companies and insurers efficient healthcare solutions for their employees and customers. To make available to physicians a technologically advanced and optimized work platform.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Marketing and Content Specialist

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Marketing and content specialistwill play a central role in bringing Euracare’s brand to life through integrated content, campaign execution, public relations, events, and coordination of all advertising channels.
	This role requires a proactive, organized, and creative communicator who can manage multiple stakeholders, develop compelling messaging, and ensure brand consistency across all touchpoints.


Key Responsibilities
Content Development & Messaging:


	Write high-quality, patient-friendly content for the website, social media, newsletters, brochures, blogs, doctor profiles, and internal communication.
	Develop scripts, talking points, and narratives for video content, interviews, and patient education campaigns.


Content Strategy and Calendar Management:


	Work with the marketing team to develop and execute a social media content strategy that aligns with Euracare’s brand voice and business goals.
	Plan, schedule, and manage a social media content calendar, ensuring timely and consistent delivery of content.


Community Engagement:


	Monitor and respond to comments and messages on social media platforms in a professional and empathetic manner, fostering a positive and interactive online community.


Website Content Management:


	Regularly update website content to ensure it is fresh, accurate, and optimized for search engines (SEO).


Campaign Planning & Execution:


	Support development and rollout of multi-channel campaigns in collaboration with the digital and creative teams.
	Coordinate timelines, approvals, and deliverables for campaigns.
	Track campaign results and contribute to post-campaign reviews.


Doctor & Department Coordination:


	Build strong relationships with doctors and department heads to identify marketing opportunities, patient stories (with consent), and updates.
	Schedule content interviews, coordinate input from medical teams, and manage internal approvals.


PR & Media Relations:


	Draft press releases and coordinate outreach to media outlets, including arranging interviews and providing background materials.
	Build and maintain a network of healthcare and lifestyle media contacts.
	Support crisis communication and reputation management efforts as needed.


Event Management:


	Plan and coordinate hospital-hosted events such as screenings, awareness campaigns, open days, and partner activations.
	Manage logistics, collateral, invitations, vendor coordination, and event-day execution.
	Capture feedback, document results, and support post-event reporting.


Strategic Input:


	Support quarterly marketing planning and annual campaign roadmap development.
	Conduct basic market research and competitor monitoring.
	Suggest ideas for outreach campaigns, partnerships, and community health initiatives.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications, Public Relations, or a related field.
	Experience: At least 3 years of proven experience as a Content Writer, Social Media Manager, or similar role, with a strong portfolio of published work, preferably in the healthcare or a related industry.
	Healthcare Knowledge: A solid understanding of medical terminology and the ability to simplify complex health concepts for a lay audience.
	Exceptional Writing Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a keen eye for detail, grammar, and style.
	Social Media Proficiency: In-depth knowledge of various social media platforms, their algorithms, and content best practices.
	Creativity: A creative mindset with the ability to generate fresh and innovative content ideas.
	Research Skills: Strong research abilities to gather credible information from reputable sources.
	Soft Skills: Excellent time management skills, the ability to work independently, and a collaborative spirit to work effectively within a team.
	Technical Skills: Familiarity with social media management tools and basic SEO principles is a plus.


Salary
N350,000 - N400,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@euracare.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Digital Marketing Specialist

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Digital Campaign Execution:


	Plan and execute targeted digital campaigns across Meta (Facebook & Instagram), Google Ads, YouTube, and LinkedIn.
	Manage ad budgets, keyword strategies, A/B testing, audience segmentation, and performance optimization.


Social Media Management:


	Schedule and publish regular content across platforms
	Optimize content performance through hashtags, timing, audience targeting, and engagement tactics.
	Collaborate with the marketing officer for storytelling and campaign launches.


SEO & Website Oversight:


	Conduct keyword research and optimize website content (meta tags, headings, alt text, etc.).
	Monitor technical SEO elements (page speed, indexing, mobile responsiveness).
	Coordinate with developers to implement web updates, landing pages, or patient tools.


Email & WhatsApp Marketing:


	Create automated and segmented campaigns using tools like Mailchimp, HubSpot, or similar.
	Manage WhatsApp Business campaigns for appointment reminders, educational tips, and patient engagement.
	Track open rates, click-throughs, and conversions; suggest improvements based on performance.


CRM Management:


	Maintain and segment patient databases for targeted communications.
	Work with the operations team to ensure patient journey flows are reflected in the CRM.


Analytics & Reporting:


	Generate weekly/monthly performance dashboards from Google Analytics, Meta Insights, and other relevant platforms.
	Provide actionable insights to improve campaign effectiveness and patient acquisition.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, IT, or related field.
	3+ years experience in digital marketing, preferably in healthcare or service sectors.
	Proven skills in Meta Ads, Google Ads, SEO, email automation tools, and CRM systems.
	Strong analytical and reporting abilities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@euracare.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

3.) Media Production Specialist

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a versatile and skilled Media Production Specialist to create engaging visual content for all of Euracare’s digital and print platforms.
	The ideal candidate will be a creative storyteller with a strong eye for design and a passion for video production.
	You'll be responsible for developing a wide range of visual assets, from social media graphics and website banners to promotional videos and internal communications.


Key Responsibilities


	Graphic Design: Design and create compelling visual content for our website, social media channels, email newsletters, presentations, and print materials (e.g., brochures, flyers).
	Videography & Editing: Plan, shoot, and edit high-quality video content, including patient testimonials, facility tours, promotional videos, and educational clips for social media and our website.
	Branding & Consistency: Ensure all visual materials align with Euracare’s brand guidelines, maintaining a consistent and professional look and feel across all platforms.
	Content Strategy: Collaborate with the marketing team to brainstorm and develop visual content strategies that support our marketing campaigns and business goals.
	Photography: Capture high-quality photographs of our facilities, staff, and events as needed for marketing purposes.
	Project Management: Manage multiple projects from concept to completion, ensuring all deliverables are met on time and to a high standard.
	Stay Current: Keep up-to-date with the latest design software, video production techniques, and digital trends to ensure our content remains fresh and innovative.


Requirements


	Education: A Bachelor’s Degree in Graphic Design, Fine Arts, Film, or a related field is preferred.
	Experience: At least 3 years of proven experience as a Graphic Designer and Videographer with a strong portfolio showcasing a range of design and video projects.
	Software Proficiency: Expertise in graphic design software (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite, including Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign) and video editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, Final Cut Pro).
	Technical Skills: Strong understanding of camera equipment, lighting, and audio for video production. Knowledge of motion graphics and animation is a plus.
	Creativity & Vision: A creative mindset with the ability to translate complex ideas into visually stunning and effective content.
	Communication: Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively within a team and take direction.
	Attention to Detail: A meticulous eye for detail to ensure all final products are polished and error-free.


Salary
N350,000 - N400,000 monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@euracare.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Head, Human Resources Job at the Concept Group




        
    

        
        The Concept Group is a holding company for companies established in 1992. Subsidiaries under the Group include: Rosabon Financial Services - Nigeria’s Leading Financial Intermediary and Equipment Leasing Company, Concept Nova - Bespoke Enterprise IT Solutions Company, Percy Aitkins - Bureau De Change.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Human Resources

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Head, Human Resources is directly responsible for the overall administration, coordination and strategic evaluation of the human resources department for the entire group.
	He/she will be responsible for all Human Resources related solutions that influence business decisions.
	The Head, HR will also improve HR initiatives, enhancing staff morale and relations between staff and management, contribute to attaining business goals,promote good HR practices and attract talented recruits to meet the organization’s needs.


Responsibilities


	Develops organization strategies by identifying and researching human resources issues; contributing information, analysis, and recommendations to organization strategic thinking and direction; establishing human resources objectives in line with organizational objectives.
	Implements human resources strategies by establishing department accountabilities, including talent acquisition, staffing, employment processing, compensation, health and welfare benefits, training and development, records management, safety and health, succession planning, employee relations and retention,and labor relations.
	Manages human resources operations by overseeing recruitment, selection, orientation, training, coaching,counseling, and disciplining of staff; planning, monitoring, appraising, and reviewing staff job contributions, maintaining compensation, determining production, productivity, quality, and customer-service strategies, designing systems; accumulating resources; resolving problems; implementing change.
	Develops human resources operations budgets and financial strategies by estimating, forecasting, and anticipating requirements, trends, and variances; aligning monetary resources; developing action plans,measuring and analyzing results; initiating corrective actions; minimizing the impact of variances.
	Accomplishes special project results by identifying and clarifying issues and priorities; communicating and coordinating requirements; expediting fulfillment; evaluating milestone accomplishments; evaluating optional courses of action; changing assumptions and direction.
	Supports management by providing human resources advice, counsel, and decisions; analyzing information and applications.
	Guides management and employee actions by researching, developing, writing, and updating policies, procedures, methods, and guidelines; communicating and enforcing organization values.
	Complies with federal, state, and local legal requirements by studying existing and new legislation; anticipating legislation; enforcing adherence to requirements; advising management on needed actions.
	Lead and support the development and implementation of HR policy across all units of the department, and areas of the organization including improving performance, maximizing attendance and providing effective management of change and development.
	Direct and work with the HR team to develop, co-ordinate, implement and audit all HR activity within the department and across the organization.
	Assists executive management in the annual review, preparation and administration of group’s salary productivity target.
	Updates job knowledge by participating in conferences and educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
	Enhances department and organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.
	Works directly with department managers to assist them in carrying out their responsibilities on personnel matters.
	Participates on committees and special projects and seeks additional responsibilities.
	Maintain effective employee relations including participation, consultation and negotiation with representative bodies and ensure maintenance of productive working relationships with all colleagues.
	Ensure effective implementation of the disciplinary and grievance procedures for all employee groups.
	Effectively oversee all human resources activities, authorizations and approvals.
	Ensure smooth, seamless operations and coherence both intra and inter-departmentally
	Periodically receives and collates reports from all unit heads, and sends to management accordingly.

Requirements


	A Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources Management or any other related field.
	At least 7 years of post-graduation experience, with cognitive experience in full-cycle HR experience
	4 additional years of relevant experience may be substituted in lieu of degree.
	Excellent knowledge of MS Office, more importantly, Excel with an ability to analyze data.
	Recognized professional qualification (e.g. CIPD, CIPM, PHRi, SPHRi).

N700,000 Monthly.
